Amharic proverbs.Ge'ez Writing: ክፉ : ቀን : እና : ዝግምግምን : ጎንበስ :ብሎ : ማሳለፍ።
Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: let bad days and signs of trouble passby with a bowed head.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: Mind your own business and get out of the way.

Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: you won't get promoted without speaking up.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: It doesn't hurt to ask.Closed mouths don't get fed.

Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: When you beautify yourself, you get bald spots.
Art and relatives are better experienced from a distance.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: Distance makes the heart grow fonder.
don't stay busy with running around, instead pray.

Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: keep advising, if they don't take heed, suffering will be their best advisor.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: If someone is stuborn in the face of wisdom, let them go out and get hurt - that'll learn best through trial and error.

Amharic proverbs.Ge'ez Writing: እኔው : በገዛ : እጄ : ብዬ : ወረድ : ወረድ ፣ እመቤቱን : ልቤን : አደረግኩት : ገረድ።
Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: By my own free will I humbled my heart and turned myself into a slave.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: Don't degrade yourself infront of others too much or they'll see it as weakness and take advantage of you.

Amharic proverbs.English Literal Translation: I have a lamb in the sky and I don't see the milk.
Amharic proverbs.English Equivalent Proverbs: I'm only rich in my head.
